definition: to present to a superior/memorial/petition/to present (a certain appearance)/to assume (a shape)/to be (a certain color)
to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)

sentences.english: What of concerns that we are sacrificing our privacy to marketers?
sentences.chinese: 将我们的隐私呈献给市场营销者有何意义？

sentences.english: We are specialized in manufacturing the converting equipment of fabric coatings.
sentences.chinese: 呈献给您的也将是最领先最优越的设备。

sentences.english: London Sophistication, Shanghai Style, Exclusively Created by Guoman.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦格调，上海风情，惟有国丰呈献。

sentences.english: He offers it to the princess to eat, and her beauty is restored.
sentences.chinese: 他将胡桃呈献给公主吃，于是公主恢复了美丽。

sentences.english: Such a petition, fervently presented, will elevate the spirit of all your devotions .
sentences.chinese: 如此热诚呈献的祷词将提升你挚爱之灵。

sentences.english: A 24 bit drum performance by primary school student of Wen Kai, Penang.
sentences.chinese: 由槟城文开小学学生呈献的二十四节令鼓。

sentences.english: In addition, the two father and son and plans to raise the home of the elephant was presented to the king of the country.
sentences.chinese: 此外，两父子并计划将家中饲养的大象呈献给国皇。

sentences.english: Two Photographers will showcase the recent works of Li Gang and Zhou Jun.
sentences.chinese: 两个摄影师将会呈献李刚和周军的最新力作。

sentences.english: Since I gave my heart to Jesus, The longer I serve Him.
sentences.chinese: 从我把心呈献给主开始，我事主越恒久。

definition: collecting together (of distinguished people or exquisite objects)/to gather/to assemble
repository of items of cultural significance/collection
to put effort into (work, farming, writing etc)/a masterpiece
collecting together (of distinguished people or exquisite objects)/to gather/to assemble
to pick/to select/to take/to capture (data)/to acquire/to pick up (a signal)
to make a pilgrimage (to visit a holy site)/to go on a sightseeing tour
to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
